technology.short_description: Performed correctly, this sequence will allow Nakai to add additional forces to his burgeoning horde, that the Wanderer's enemies may feel his might and tremble.
If its sacred plaque has been correctly interpreted, completion of this sequence will gift Nakai's horde with increased capacity, so larger forces may be fielded and his enemies be crushed.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: This sequence will increase the capacity of Nakai's rapidly-growing horde, meaning he can field a much larger force, making the prospect of facing this terrifying adversary all the more daunting.
Assuming the Skink Priests' interpretation of its sacred plaque was correct, greater numbers of Lizardmen warriors will become available, so that Nakai might repel the warm-blooded interlopers.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +15 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: This sequence, concerning battle tactics, will make even more Skinks, Saurus and the myriad forms of beastly reptiles available to Nakai's horde, that he might slay the enemies of the Lizardmen utterly.
If correctly performed, this sequence will mean Nakai's by-now mighty horde will be able to field an even greater, deadlier force than ever before – surely his enemies will crumble in its wake?

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +40 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: If the Skink Priests have carried out their duties to the letter, this sequence will increase the capacity for Nakai's horde to field armies even more, so he may defeat the hated warmblood foe.
Like a ghost in fog, Nakai seems to simply appear where the Lizardmen need him most.

effects.description: Nakai will aid you when defending for 60 seconds (if not in the same province)

technology.short_description: There are many places in crisis across the world, thus there are many places Nakai must be.

effects.description: Nakai will aid you when defending for 120 seconds (if not in the same province)

technology.short_description: In the most dire of circumstances, Nakai can be depended on to remain steadfast.

effects.description: Nakai will aid you when defending for 240 seconds (if not in the same province)

technology.short_description: According to the relevant plaque, this sequence will reduce the cost of successive spawnings of all types of Lizardmen warriors into Nakai's forces.
To the victors the spoils! This sequence guarantees that income gained from sacking and looting following a settlement battle will be increased significantly.
Like all races, there are disparate factions within Lizardmen society; completion of this sequence will help them find common ground and focus on freeing Lustria from the warmblood infestation.

technology.onscreen_name: Determining the Strength of the Old
technology.short_description: Even from their initial spawning, this sequence ensures that Nakai's new Lizardmen Lords will have improved leadership abilities from the very beginning, that they might force the warmbloods from Lustrian shores.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

technology.short_description: The venerated Old Ones, whose Great Plan Nakai and the Lizardmen are sworn to complete, bless their children and keep them pure in the face of insidious corruption from without.
Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan empowers the Old Ones’ children to share their creators’ resilience against the age-old enemy.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
Immune to Chaos corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition

technology.short_description: The jungle itself is a predator; this sequence improves the hardiness of Nakai's hordes, so fewer of their number fall on campaign when not fighting battles.

effects.description: Attrition: -40% casualties suffered from all attrition

technology.short_description: Nakai does not spend much time thinking. Nakai acts, and he acts quickly.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: All respassers must die. This is unquestionable.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: This sequence, if completed as per the Old Ones' coded instructions, will mean that construction is swifter and cheaper for Nakai and his reptilian brethren.
No beings are more able to flourish and prosper within the ultra-humid jungles of Lustria than the Lizardmen; this sequence improves Nakai's ability to see danger and respond more quickly.
Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan sees a greater number of braves gain the Old Ones’ approbation, making them harder to kill.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, your Heroes will be wounded instead

technology.short_description: Successfully completing this sequence will improve the chances of success of Nakai's Lizardmen Heroes' clandestine actions, whilst diminishing those of their foes.
The steps inherent to completion of this sequence enable Nakai's hordes to spawn en masse and within a significantly shorter timeframe, enabling the Wanderer to meet growing threats head on.
Nakai is revered by the Skink Priests, who heap upon him beautiful, enchanted gold adornments as he passes through Temple-Cities.
The background hum grows to a roar when focused on.
As they are naturally the weaker sub-race of Lizardmen, the Skinks can be strengthened by completing this sequence correctly, increasing their worth on the battlefield exponentially.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units
Missile strength: +15% for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Chameleon Stalker units

technology.short_description: The monstrous beasts fielded by the Lizardmen are truly terrifying; correct completion of this sequence can only make them more so – as the Old Ones surely intended.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units
Charge bonus: +20 for Cold One units
Missile strength: +15% for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Missile strength: +10% for Terradon Riders units

technology.short_description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan grants boons unto the Kroxigor, augmenting their blood-curdling roars.

effects.description: Attribute: Causes Terror for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

technology.short_description: This sequence improves the base-level experience of freshly-spawned Skinks, improving their usefulness on the battlefield and increasing the likelihood of victory exponentially.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -20% for Skink and Chameleon Skinks units

technology.short_description: Even without the experiential benefits of this sequence, the Saurus warrior-class are fearsome adversaries; completing it correctly will make them even more formidable in the field.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Temple Guards units
Recruitment cost: -20% for Saurus and Temple Guards units

technology.short_description: The Old Ones rain blessings upon Nakai as he rains death upon those who disrupt The Great Plan.

effects.description: Bonus vs infantry: +10 for Kroxigors and Sacred Kroxigors units

technology.short_description: The Saurus are already near-peerless warriors; this sequence, if completed carefully and to the letter, will increase their battlefield capabilities even further.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Saurus and Temple Guards units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.short_description: Progress in sequences crucial to the Great Plan sees convalescent abilities become more prevalent within the horde; tails and limbs regrow as easily as scratches heal!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Kroxigors and Sacred Kroxigors units

technology.short_description: Following these steps carefully will mean mounts recruited afterwards will be more experienced than their newly-spawned peers before a drop of blood has been spilled.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Cold One units
Recruit rank: +2 for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units
Recruit rank: +2 for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, Coatl, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Recruitment cost: -20% for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, Coatl, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units

technology.short_description: No amount of gold is as worthy as a single word of praise from an Old One.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -40% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

technology.short_description: Layer upon layer of growth makes these scale nigh impenetrable.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 10% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

technology.short_description: The Lizardmen train the savage reptiles of the Lustrian jungles to slay their enemies in battle; completion of this sequence will ensure they are even more brutal and aggressive in the fray.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Stegadon, Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
Weapon strength: +10% for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
Charge bonus: +15 for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
Missile strength: +10% for Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Bastiladon units
Missile resistance: 10% for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, and Ancient Salamander units

technology.short_description: Successful completion of this sequence will ensure those who guard the Lizardmen's temples to the Old Ones are better able to repel attackers from their sacred spaces.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Kroxigors and Sacred Kroxigors units
Melee attack: +4 for Temple Guards units
Melee attack: +4 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Melee defence: +4 for Temple Guards units
Spell resistance: 4% for Saurus and Temple Guards units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.short_description: This sequence is used to produce the larger beasts used by the Lizardmen, but at higher experience levels than an ordinary spawning would produce.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Ancient Salamander and Dread Saurian units
Recruitment cost: -20% for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Dread Saurian units
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Dread Saurian units

technology.short_description: Completion of this sequence ensures certain spawnings will be more experienced from birth and therefore require less training to be effective.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
Recruit rank: +2 for Temple Guards units
Global recruitment duration: -1 turns for Kroxigor units

technology.short_description: This sequence increases the rate of growth of Nakai's horde, enabling the construction of more buildings and eventually swelling its population; soon, the warmbloods will flee afore them!
When war is a constant state, losses are guaranteed – whether through attrition or casualties on the battlefield; this sequence helps Nakai to replenish their numbers for the next fight.
Completion of this sequence not only improves the growth rate of Nakai's hordes, it also keeps construction costs as low as possible, to aid their advance and free Lustria from foreign invaders.

This sequence will increase Nakai's hordes' magical reserves and help to replenish their losses due to war and attrition, that they may continue their relentless slaying of the foe in service of the Great Plan.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

technology.short_description: Those horde-members wounded in battle against Nakai's foes will be replaced or recover from their injuries more quickly, assuming this sequence is completed correctly, of course.
Nakai's horde will inevitably suffer losses over the course of a campaign; completing this sequence will aid replenishment of its numbers whilst also bolstering its rate of growth.
When completed successfully, this sequence will replace Nakai's losses and reduce the cost of keeping his horde together and in peak fighting condition.
Implacable ferocity grants these powerful Kroxigor unshakable courage.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

technology.short_description: The hierarchy of control is an innate truth.
Ancient wisdom grants ancient power.

effects.description: Armour-Piercing Melee Damage: +100 for Kroxigor Ancient
